ovdesc.p: The Words Table is used to convert numbers to words, in various languages. (Currently, amounts can only be translated into English.)

desc.p: Name of the '1000000000', and plural, in the appropriate language.
1-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multivalue (2 fields, single and plural). (Mandatory input)
Name of the '100', and plural, in the appropriate language.
1-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multivalue (2 fields, single and plural). (Mandatory input)
Names of the 'tens' 10 to 90 in the appropriate language.
1-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multivalue (9 fields). (Mandatory input)
Enter 'Y' if the last unit is tens.
e.g. For German, amounts are specified as zwei und zwanzig (two and twenty), so 'y' should be entered, but for English, the last unit is not tens, twenty two so 'N' should be entered.
1 type A (alphanumeric) character. (Optional input; default 'N')
This field is reserved for future expansion.
A maximum of 1 character may be entered.

This field is reserved for future expansion.

The word 'and' should be entered here in the appropriate language, if it is used in numbers.
1-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input)
Describes which language the words in this record are in.
Descriptions may be entered in each of the languages defined in the LANGUAGE table.
1-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input)
Allows a specified routine to be called to perform the translation of amounts into a particular language. This is required where a language is not defined in DE.WORDS.
Standard info basic routine name.
